Guess the word in 6 tries!!

Each guess must be a valid 5-letter word. Click Enter to Submit.

After each guess, the tile colors will change to show how close your guess was to the actual word.
The letter within the GREEN box is in the word and in the correct spot.
The letter within the YELLOW box is in the word but in the wrong spot.
The letter within the GREY box is not in the word in any spot.
A new word will be available each time you play!

Pawns only move forward. A pawn can move 2 spaces on its first move, but only 1 space after. Pawns move diagonally to take opponents. If a pawn reaches the opposite side of the board, it is promoted to a knight.
Rooks move in a continuous line forwards, backwards or side-to-side.
Knights move in different orientations of the shape L.
Bishops move in a continuous diagonal in any direction.
The Queen moves in continuous diagonal and straight lines in all directions.
The King can move one square at a time in any direction without coming under check.
A king is in check when an opponent piece can attack the king.
Putting an opponent king in Checkmate is the only way to win the game. A Stalemate is a tie which occurs when there are no legal moves for a player to make.
